properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 8 at 12:47PM AKST until February 9 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Expect snow and blowing
snow to reduce visibility to near zero at times. Winds gusting
up to 50 mph. Additional snow accumulations of up to 16 inches
expected.

* WHERE...Through Thompson Pass.

* WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Falling snow and areas of blowing snow may reduce
visibility to near zero at times. Travel may be extremely
difficult.
properties.instruction:
A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay
with your vehicle.

For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit
511.alaska.gov.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SUNDAY FOR THOMPSON PASS
